name: Advanced Technology & Computational Intelligence
description: Sophisticated terminology for cutting-edge technology, artificial intelligence, cybernetics, and computational science.
context: advanced technology, artificial intelligence, cybernetics, and computational systems

words.meaning: a finite sequence of well-defined instructions for solving computational problems
a problem-solving approach that employs practical methods not guaranteed to be optimal
a computing system modeled on biological neural networks for pattern recognition
a subset of AI that enables systems to learn and improve from experience automatically
machine learning using artificial neural networks with multiple layers
the science of communication and control theory in machines and living beings
computation using quantum-mechanical phenomena like superposition and entanglement
a decentralized, distributed ledger technology ensuring secure and transparent transactions
digital currency secured by cryptography and operating independently of central banks
the practice of secure communication through encoding and decoding information
automated recognition of individuals based on biological and behavioral characteristics
manipulation of matter on atomic and molecular scale for advanced applications
technology based on biology, especially when used in agriculture and medicine
technology overlaying digital information onto the real-world environment
computer-generated simulation creating immersive three-dimensional environments
technology enabling processes to operate without human intervention
interdisciplinary branch involving design, construction, and operation of robots
protection of computer systems and networks from digital attacks and threats
close observation and monitoring of people or activities using technology
process of converting information into a code to prevent unauthorized access
process of converting encrypted data back to its original readable form
network security system monitoring and controlling incoming and outgoing traffic
malicious software designed to damage, disrupt, or gain unauthorized access
fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information by disguising as trustworthy entity
malicious software that encrypts files and demands payment for decryption
maximum rate of data transfer across a network or communication channel
delay between input and output in a system or network communication
set of rules governing communication between computer systems or networks
point of interaction between computer systems, users, or software components
fundamental organization and design principles of computer systems or software
ability of a system to handle increased workload or expanded functionality
duplication of critical components to increase reliability and prevent failure
process of making systems or algorithms as effective and efficient as possible
creation of virtual versions of computing resources like servers or operating systems
delivery of computing services over the internet with on-demand resource access
